ftlDrives.name: Jump Drive
ftlDrives.description: The jump drive relies on matter transmission technology. It requires enormous power, annihilating massive amounts of hydrogen fuel for a single jump. Distance depends on fuel expended.
ftlDrives.notes: Requires fuel tank (5-50% of hull). Takes 1d4 hours to cycle between jumps.

ftlDrives.name: Wormhole Screen
ftlDrives.description: Masks the ship's mass from natural wormholes, allowing transit without triggering collapse. The ship cannot choose its destination - it goes wherever the wormhole leads.
ftlDrives.notes: Requires 2d4 hours for course calculations. Only works with natural wormholes.

ftlDrives.name: Gate Activator
ftlDrives.description: Keys a gate device which functions as a teleporter to another gate. Most of the work is done by the gate itself, so power requirements are modest.
ftlDrives.notes: Gate cycle time typically 2d4 hours minimum.

ftlDrives.name: Hyperdrive
ftlDrives.description: Hurls the ship into an alternate dimension where lightspeed is meaningless. Requires navigation plotting (1d4 x 10 minutes). Cannot change course once engaged.
ftlDrives.notes: Minimum 10% hull allocation. Can drop out of hyperspace at any time.

ftlDrives.name: Stardrive
ftlDrives.description: Creates a controlled singularity that drops the ship into drivespace. All submergences last 121 hours (about 5 days). Must be coupled to a mass reactor.
ftlDrives.notes: Base distance varies by ship class. Extra power increases range. Recharge time d4+1 days.

ftlDrives.name: Drivewave
ftlDrives.description: An improvement of the stardrive. Drivespace submergence lasts only 11 hours, and recharge time is only d4+1 hours.
ftlDrives.notes: Base distance varies by ship class. Extra power increases range.

ftlDrives.name: Spacefold Drive
ftlDrives.description: Folds space, allowing instant leaps of dozens or hundreds of light-years. Range determined by power allocated to the drive.
ftlDrives.notes: Cycles almost instantly but must travel 5d20 x 10 AU from arrival before safe to use again.

ftlDrives.name: Psychoportive Drive
ftlDrives.description: Uses psionic energy to defeat restrictions of time and space. Works like a jump drive but burns psionic energy points instead of fuel.
ftlDrives.notes: PEP cost varies by ship class. Each jump takes one full day.

ftlDrives.name: Transcendent Drive
ftlDrives.description: Harnesses a psionic character's power to unlock unfathomable energies. Speed equals the pilot's psionic energy points in light-years per hour.
ftlDrives.notes: Pilot can stay in the chair for up to 8 hours before exhaustion.

ftlDrives.name: Warpdrive
ftlDrives.description: Creates a warp field where normal physics are suspended. Can gather information, change course, stop, or start at will while traveling.
